column4: could anyone please help me try to get my monitor to display in native resolution? no matter what i change in xorg.conf all i get in the screens and graphics window is the same old generic "plug and play" monitor
Have you tried adding resolutions and the like to your xorg.conf?
Did you add that resolution to your xorg.conf and then select it as default?
yes but no matter what values i add i get the default 640x480, 800x600, 1024x768 and 1600x1200 to choose from in the screen and graphics window
Weird
what do you mean select it as the default
And look at what resolutions i gives you, choose then ones you want
and akorn ok i'll try
can you pastebin your xorg, please
this was my xorg.conf until i just reconfigured it http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/51114/
what is the res you need?
yes 1366 x 768 would be ideal
Was it a tv?
that is correct
Hmm.. Try sudo nvidia-settings
Or just nvidia-settings
i dont think that worked. i got the ability to change like 5 irrelevant options and i got some error messages in the terminal like "unable to detect number of nvidia GPUs"
i guess when i reconfigured xorg it disabled the restricted driver
As far as I can tell you need to set the widescreen options from that, it seems a very common issue with the widescreens,
Well, it should read xorg and list the proper res
